thread.title: Keira Knightley suffers injury, cancelling ‘Therese Raquin’
thread.title_full: Keira Knightley suffers injury, cancelling ‘Therese Raquin’ - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Keira Knightley suffers injury, cancelling ‘Therese Raquin’
text:
Bruce Glikas Keira Knightley is seen performing on Oct. 1. On Wednesday, she suffered a minor injury during production of "Therese Raquin." There's more unscripted drama on Broadway at "Therese Raquin."
Star Keira Knightley suffered a minor injury on Wednesday, forcing the play based on Emile Zola's novel to go dark that night.
There were no more details about the injury.
The Roundabout Theater Company hopes to resume performances again Thursday at 8 p.m.
All ticket holders can exchange their tickets at the point of sale.
It's been a trying first week for Knightley, who is making her Broadway debut in the production.
The show's first preview on Oct. 1 was disrupted when a fan in the mezzanine shouted at Knightley and threw flowers onto the stage. Security escorted him out.
Related Stories Keira Knightley’s Broadway debut disrupted by fan
